== Installation Problems ==

=== Desktop CD Install ===
* Installer will crash if manual partitioning is used.<nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/47194|#47194]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/48472|#48472]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/48328|#48328]]</nowiki>.

=== Alternate CD Install ===

=== DVD Install ===
* Installing from dvd and choosing italian results at the end in a full english installation (other languages may also be affected) <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/39483|#39483]]</nowiki>
** Workaround: install manually your own language <code>sudo apt-get install language-support-[lang] kde-i18n-[lang]</code>

== Upgrading Problems ==
* Upgrading from breezy uninstalls kubuntu-desktop package <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/39658|#39658]]</nowiki>
** Workaround: install kubuntu-desktop package after upgrade  <code>sudo apt-get install kubuntu-desktop</code>

== Post Install Problems ==

=== Hardware related ===
* CPU Scaling not working <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/distros/ubuntu/+source/linux-source-2.6.15/+bug/36014|#36014]]</nowiki>
* Some multimedia keyboard keys may not function, specifically the Raise Volume key <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/distros/ubuntu/+source/kubuntu-meta/+bug/37341|#37341]]</nowiki>
** Workaround: to enable the raise volume key, run <code>xmodmap -e "keycode 175 ="</code>
* Using fglrx or ati drivers may cause KDM/xorg to freeze on logout or reboot <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/distros/ubuntu/+source/xserver-xorg-driver-ati/+bug/30447|#30447]]</nowiki>
** Workaround: add (uncomment) the line <code>TerminateServer=true</code> to section <code>[X-:*-Core]</code> in <code>/etc/kde3/kdm/kdmrc</code>
* Using the latest fglrx driver (8.25.18) renders GLX unusable for some Radeon based cards
** Workaround: use older version of libGL.so.2.1 as described here: <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=185033]]</nowiki>
* When using some sound cards with an additional usb sound card sometimes the usb sound card will get /dev/dsp0 and get all sounds by default. This was not the case for breezy (or any other distro I stumbled upon) <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/distros/ubuntu/+bug/46996|#46996]]</nowiki>

=== Installing Software ===
* Add/Remove Programs (adept installer) hangs on installation of packages that require confirmations (for example license, like flashplugin-nonfree, sun-java5-*...) <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/37696|#37696]]</nowiki>
** Workaround: install packages from command line - i.e. <code>sudo apt-get install</code> or <code>sudo aptitude install</code>
* Packages installed with Adept may not immediately add icons to the kmenu <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/distros/ubuntu/+source/kdebase/+bug/40048|a#40048]]</nowiki>
** Workaround: run <code>kbuildsycoca</code> to regenerate KDE resource cache, OR log out and log back in, OR open the menu editor and click the 'save' button, OR install packages from command line - i.e. <code>sudo apt-get install</code> or <code>sudo aptitude install</code>

=== Konqueror ===
* Konqueror crashing on web pages with Real media streams <nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/bugs/31055|#31055]]</nowiki>
** Workaround: copy fixed profilerc file from the bug attachement to <code>/usr/share/kubuntu-default-settings/kde-profile/default/share/config/profilerc</code>
* Konqueror as integrated viewer of compressed files doesn't work
** Workdaround: <code>rm -R /usr/share/kubuntu-default-settings/kde-profile/default/share/mimelnk/application/</code>

=== KScreensaver ===
* KDE hooks for xscreensaver-data-extra and xscreensaver-gl-extra are missing <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/48056|#48056]]</nowiki>
* kscreensaver-xsavers is installed but xscreensavers from xscreensaver-* packages are missing <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/bugs/49228|#49228]]</nowiki>
** Workaround: <code>sudo sed -i -e 's/TryExec=xscreensaver//' /usr/share/applnk/System/ScreenSavers/*</code>

=== Printing ===
* Printing (CUPS) not working for everyone ( is there a malone report ? if not can we be more specific about what in cups is not working ? did it not automatically setup a printer , did it remove a printer that was automatically setup ? is the cupsd services not starting ? etc etc etc , thanks )
** Kurt Pfeifle's blog contains a fairly detailed run down of the problems with the Kubuntu Dapper CUPS setup (as he sees it) from which some bug reports may be distilled: <nowiki>[[http://www.kdedevelopers.org/node/2064|Part 1]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.kdedevelopers.org/node/2072|Part 2]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.kdedevelopers.org/node/2076|Part 3]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.kdedevelopers.org/node/2077|Part 3 (Update)]]</nowiki>.
* Printing problems with Foomatic drivers <nowiki>[[http://launchpad.net/bugs/42965|#42965]]</nowiki>
** Workaround: run <code>sudo foomatic-cleanupdrivers</code>
